title: Watson & Crick (and Franklin): DNA's Unequal Credit
description: A quick, practical guide to Watson & Crick (and Franklin): DNA's Unequal Credit.

hook.text: Watson and Crick discovered DNA's structure in 1953. Rosalind Franklin's X-ray image made it possible. She got no Nobel.

buildup.text: Watson was brash and intuitive. Crick was methodical and theoretical. Together they built physical models of DNA.

discovery.text: Franklin's Photo 51 â€” an X-ray diffraction image â€” showed DNA was a helix. It was shown to Watson without her consent.

twist.text: Franklin died of ovarian cancer in 1958 at 37 â€” likely from radiation exposure. Nobel Prizes aren't given posthumously.

climax.text: Watson's book barely mentioned her. Crick later admitted her contribution was essential. History is slowly correcting.

punchline.text: The greatest discovery in biology was built on uncredited genius.
